space.arim.api.server.bungee

Class BungeeRegistrable

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.api.server.PluginRegistrable
      • space.arim.api.server.bungee.BungeeRegistrable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultAsyncExecution, DefaultSyncExecution, DefaultTPSMeter, DefaultUUIDResolver

    public abstract class BungeeRegistrable
extends PluginRegistrable
    A helper class for resources registered on BungeeCord.
    Subclassing BungeeRegistrable provides useful default implementations of Registrable.getName(), Registrable.getAuthor(), and Registrable.getVersion() based on the corresponding Plugin. See PluginRegistrable.getName(), PluginRegistrable.getAuthor(), and PluginRegistrable.getVersion() for details.

    Usage:
    1. The service type must be an interface to use BungeeRegistrable.
    2. Let your registered implementation extend BungeeRegistrable.
    4. Provide super constructor BungeeRegistrable(Plugin) with your plugin main.

    Example:
    You want your resource called 'SuperChat' to be registered as a ChatProvider (Note that ChatProvider must be an interface which extends Registrable).
    Your SuperChat class should look this: 
    
 public class SuperChat extends BungeeRegistrable implements ChatProvider {
   public SuperChat(Plugin plugin) {
     super(plugin);
   }
   public byte getPriority() {
     return RegistryPriority.NORMAL;
   }
 }
    Your main plugin class should look like this: 
    
 public class SuperChatPlugin extends Plugin {
    @Override
   public void onEnable() {
     // Creating your SuperChat chat provider
     SuperChat chat = new SuperChat(this);
     // Registering your chat provider
     UniversalRegistry.get().register(ChatProvider.class, chat);
   }
 }
    Good, now you don't have to worry about overriding #getName, #getAuthor, and #getVersion in your SuperChat resource. BungeeRegistrable automatically takes care of all of that.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BungeeRegistrable

        public BungeeRegistrable(net.md_5.bungee.api.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Initialises the abstract class from a provided Plugin. The plugin should be your own plugin main, of course.

        The Plugin will be used for Registrable.getName(), Registrable.getAuthor(), and Registrable.getVersion().
        Parameters:
        plugin - the plugin main

    • Method Detail

        Returns:
        the plugin
